thread.title: US pending home sales slightly short of forecast in July
thread.title_full: US pending home sales slightly short of forecast in July

title: US pending home sales slightly short of forecast in July
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Aug 27, 2015, 17:49 BST - UK Markets closed US pending home sales slightly short of forecast in July By Daniel Cancian | Sharecast â€“ 1 hour 19 minutes ago 262.60 +10.600 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - US pending home sales edged higher in July, data released on Thursday showed. The index from the National Association of Realtors (NAR) climbed 0.5% month-on-month in July, reversing the previous month's decline and climbing 7.3% year-on-year. 
Both figures, however, were below the 1.0% month-on-month gain and the 8.4% increase on a yearly basis analysts had expected. 
Lawrence Yun, chief economist at the NAR, said existing sales were expected to maintain their recent rate of growth, adding NAR forecast a 7.1% gain for 2015 existing home sales to 5.29m homes and the median price to increase by 6.3%. 
"We are inclined to interpret the softness at the start of the quarter as payback after a strong performance at the beginning of 2015 and expect the housing market to remain in recovery mode," analysts at Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) said in a note.
